db:abstract.db:para: The QPlatformSurfaceEvent class is used to notify about native platform surface events.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Platform window events are synchronously sent to windows and offscreen surfaces when their underlying native surfaces are created or are about to be destroyed.
Applications can respond to these events to know when the underlying platform surface exists.

db:section.db:title: enum QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceEventType
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the type of platform surface event. The possible types are:

db:td.db:para: The underlying native surface has been created
The underlying native surface will be destroyed immediately after this event

db:section.db:para: The SurfaceAboutToBeDestroyed event type is useful as a means of stopping rendering to a platform window before it is destroyed.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QPlatformSurfaceEvent::QPlatformSurfaceEvent(QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceEventType surfaceEventType)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a platform surface event for the given surfaceEventType.

db:section.db:title: QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceEventType QPlatformSurfaceEvent::surfaceEventType() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the specific type of platform surface event.
